headline: A Millennial Asked, 'Do You Personally Know Any Millennial Millionaires?' Turns Out, They're All Around Us—As It Should Be
summary: When one millennial asked on Reddit, ‘Do you personally know any millennial millionaires?’ they probably weren't expecting hundreds of real answers. But the replies came fast and honest—yes, they exist, and they're not as rare as people might think. headline: More than 200 S&P 500 companies scrubbed 'diversity' and 'equity' from annual reports in 2025
summary: More than 200 S&P 500 companies scrubbed words such as 'diversity' and 'equity' from their annual reports in 2025, according to a new report from Freshfields, reinforcing a widening corporate retreat from DEI.

headline: Nvidia vs. Microsoft Stock: Which Will Be the First $4 Trillion Company?

headline: 6 Reasons Berkshire Stock Has Lagged the Market—and 3 Reasons It Could Outperform Again
summary: Berkshire Hathaway  stock has badly lagged the  since the company’s annual meeting on May 3, but there’s also reason to believe the period of underperformance is over.  Berkshire Hathaway’s Class A shares ended Friday at $727,455, up 1% on the session.  Berkshire is up just under 7% so far this year, against 7.5% for the index.
